reviews.review: Bu oyuna dishonored 2 den daha diyen net kördur. Çunku bu oyun o kadar da iyi degil. Yani Dishonored gizlilik ögelerini barındıran ve o super guçleri verimli bi şekilde kullanabileceginiz bi oyunken, bu oyunu oynarken bazen o guçleri kullanmayı unutuyosunuz. Zaten guçlerin o kadar da verimli yanları yok. Her neyse hikayesi guzel, eger depresyona yatkınsanız veya oynayayım da moralim duzelsin diyorsanız sakın oynamayın. Bu dlc'ler içinde geçerli. Hikayesi ananızı siker öyle bi olay.

[b][i]Oyunu uzun uzun anlatma gereği duymuyorum sadece tek kelime yeter, oyun ''mükemmel'' olmuş.[/i]

Hikaye çok iyi işlenmiş. Başlarda hikayeyi kavradım dedim, ortalarında sonuç belli, görevi halledelim biticek dedim. Sonlarına doğru oyun öyle bi' hal aldı ki resmen beyin yakan türden. Asıl olayın daha yeni başladığını o an anladım. Oyunun hikayesinin içinde kayboldum resmen.
Oyunun bittiği vakit tadı damağımda kalmıştı. Kendi kendime [i]''biraz daha olmalı, devam etmeli burada bitmesin''[/i] dedim. Çünkü aklımda deli sorular dolanıyodu. Oyun bitmesine rağmen beni hala hikayeyi anlamaya, onu tamamlama gereği duymama sebep oldu.

Dostlar bu oyun anlat anlat bitmez, spoiler'sız da zaten bu kadar anlatılırdı. Oyunu mutlaka oynayın oynadıktan sonra sizinde aklınızda sorular varsa [url=http://fragtist.com/dosya-konusu/bioshock-infinitein-sonu-ve-gizemleri/]buraya[/url] alalım sizi :) tüm sorularınızın yanıtı orada var, çok özenli ve güzel bir şekilde açıklamışlar.[/b]

In terms of plot and story, none of the Bioshocks were great and compelling.  I did not expect a great story out of Infinite.  For me, the Bioshock games entertained me with the fun gameplay and atmosphere.  However, just my opinion, Infinite is weaker on the atmosphere because of the plot.  I liked the underwater atmosphere in 1 and 2 better, it had more combat intensity and had more claustrophobic feeling and variety of enemies.  It's still a fun game and I would play a second run in the future.

I played on hard difficulty (haven't tried 1999 yet on this game) and quite honestly, Infinite is alot easier than the previous two games on hard difficulty.  I think it has to do with the just mostly fighting humans with guns and lack of enemy variety.  I played around with the Vigors and guns butI just stuck with possession and fire vigors and used the Carbine.  That was sufficient the whole way through.  I used the RPGs a few times to clear out crowds near the end as I was tired of the waves fighting the zombies of Lady Comstock.  

Overall, fun game worth playing.

BioShock Infinite es una Obra Maestra. El juego es arte en movimiento, así de simple, cada detalle de Columbia esta trabajado en su máxima expresión. La introducción es inmejorable y el desarrollo de la historia también. Los personajes son geniales, sobretodo la dinamica entre Booker y Elizabeth. 

Elizabeth para mi sopresa no fue la tipica IA que estorba, no solo te ayuda en la batalla buscando recursos y señalandote enemigos, si no que interactua con el entorno y el jugador, llegando a parecer que incluso el juego tuviese un modo cooperativo y fuera un amigo que estuviera jugando contigo...en conclucion Elizabeth es la novedad más importante de este juego.

Asside from having the best set of lead charachters in any game ive played in my life, this also has an amazing story to it, if maybe a little confusing at first, which I think is intentional, but I still love it, and I think most of you will as well. the DLC in my opinion was not anywhere near as good as the main game, but it does help add perspective to the previous games, or at least the first bioshock. so its at least worth playing for the story. the main game is very unique artistically, and has a very good soundtrack alongside it. the guns feel powerful and look amazing, however Im frustrated to see they removed the weapon wheel in the main game, and tried to put it back in the DLC which in my opinion wasnt really good enough, it didnt really leave the player much freedom in terms of their combat choices. it also has a lot more linear areas than the orignial bioshocks which tried to promote a more open world levels design where objectives are completed at your own pace and allow you to explore areas more to find things at your own benefit. where as bioshock infinite takes a more level to level approach with not much exploration off the main areas to see what loot you can find. I am willing to look past this for making the combat a tiny bit more fast paced and having a great story however. the game to me was one of the best ive played in ercent years and i highly reccomend it.

Booker Dewitt bol veterán z boja pri Wounded Knee. Potom čo sa vrátil, rozhodol sa zmyť svoje hriechy tým, že by prijal krst a vieru. Alebo aj nie. Booker odmietol a odišiel do New Yorku. Kde sa oženil a pracoval ako detektív u Pinkrtonu a narodila sa mu dcéra Anna. Jeho žena však zomrela a on sa rozhodol svoje dlhy riešiť tým, že svoju dcéru predá neznámemu mužovi cez Roberta Lutece. Na poslednú chvíľu si to však rozmyslí, ale už je neskoro. Robert, Rosalinda a Comstock unikajú s jeho dcérou cez trhlinu. Chvíle preťahovanie má za následok, že posledný článok prsta malej Anny zostáva v jeho realite. Áno, Elizabeth je vlastne jeho dcéra Anna DeWitt (AD). Utieklo niekoľko rokov, keď došlo k tomu, že Comstock poveril Fínka, aby sabotoval Siphon a zabil tak Roberta a Rosalindu LUTECE. Tým by sa Comstock zbavil posledných svedkov toho, že Elizabeth nie je jeho dcéra.Lenže Fink LUTECE svoju sabotážou nezabil, namiesto toho im umožnil existenciu mimo priestor a čas. Preto tiež nakoniec  Booker prichádza a ponúkajú mu vykúpenie. Má nájsť svoju dcéru. Otvárajú mu trhlinu do Comstockovej reality, čím ale prichádza o svoje spomienky. (Všimnite si, že všetkým čo boli privedení mimo svoju realitu, tečie z nosa krv). Vie len, že má priniesť tú dievčinu a splatiť svoj dlh. Ďalšie veľké odhalenie je to, že Booker je vlastne Comstock. Pýtate sa prečo? Tým že Booker odmietol krst, vznikla iná realita, kde ho naopak prijal. V tejto realite sa z neho stal ortodoxní veriaci, ktorý prijal meno Comstock a vyhlásil sa prorokom. Keď potom zistil, že so svojou ženou nemôže splodiť dieťa, vydal sa do Bookerovej reality (teda vlastne reality svojho druhého ja) a dieťa získal od neho. Dieťaťu dal meno Elizabeth a snažil sa ju vychovať pre splnenie svojich cieľov. Vďaka moci Siphonu sa mohol Comstock kedykoľvek vrátiť do inej reality a dieťa opäť získať, aj keď by Booker pri záchrane uspel a Elizbeth (Annu) priviedol späť. Vďaka tomu sa Booker nachádza v akejsi slučke, ktorá ho stále vracia na začiatok. Ostatne potom čo sa dostanete do Columbie, ponúka vám LUTECE možnosť hodiť si mincou. Ako je podľa čiarok vidieť, nie je to prvýkrát. Vďaka tomu čo bolo povedané, je jasná jedna vec.Pokiaľ má byť Comstock zastavený, musí byť zastavený aj Booker. Musí ho vymazať z reality ale za cenu vlastného života. Booker je si toho vedomý a volí smrť. Opäť sa nachádzame na farme, kde sa všetko rozhodlo. Lenže namiesto toho, aby zvolil alebo nezvolil krst, volí smrť. Postupne sa objavujú ďalšie verzie Elizabeth z ostatných realít a spoločne ho utopia. Vďaka tomu, že Booker nemohol prijať či neprijať krst, nevznikol ani Comstock, ani Columbia, proste nič z toho čoho sme boli svedkom sa neodohralo. Koniec. Po titulkách je ešte krátka scéna, kde sa Booker nachádza vo svojom bytu v New Yorku. Z vedľajšej izby počujeme plač dieťaťa. To že sa Booker nechá utopiť, neznamená, že by zomrel v tomto zmysle slova. Iba neumožnil, aby vznikla realita, v ktorej existuje Comstock. It was just so up its own ass. Like, I'm as much a leftbooking shitposter as the next guy, but even I had trouble with that setting's believability and execution. They hamfistedly imported the concept of plasmids from previous games, but didn't give a fuck enough to consider integrating them into the actual setting and taking into account how that would affect anything - straight-up fucking magic, marketed as offensive battle spells in advertisements, in a setting where the average citizen has absolutely no use for them, and they're literally handing out free permanent samples of it to random people on the street. And they did the idiotic trope of pulling the moral heartstrings on whether you finished off a character or not, as though that one guy mattered where the hundreds of randos you brutally murked on your way there didn't. And the "twist" that the freedom-fighting former slave rebel was also supposed to be a monster so you didn't have to feel bad about taking her out, because BOTH SIDES AMIRITE GUYS, and then at the end the whole thing just fell the fuck apart. Elizabeth can open portals to other realities, but she had to wait for you to come bail her out of her tower, and the whole time you're with her she's an innocent snowflake, horrified at the violence you (arguably rightfully) enact upon the people you come across, but then BIG TWIST she's actually also a super-wise interdimensional pseudogod that knows for a fact everything that's been happening, moreso than Booker does, and knows for a fact that you - you, specifically, the specific Booker that you are - have to die in order to prevent the creation of more Comstocks. Somehow drowning you prevents that. Not going back in time to before anything happened and killing you then, but taking you from the present to the past, as though that's the same thing. That's like if the Terminator brought John Conner back to the past from the future to kill him, and it fucking worked.

And it's not even like you can ignore the storyline and enjoy the combat mechanics, because every plasmid is basically the same thing now, they all stun or distract a group of enemies while doing some damage, you just get to choose what flavor your powers take - you like bees? Fire? Crows? They all do the same goddamned thing, and you get all of two weapons to compliment your now-one power, and that's pretty much it. But don't worry, there's no ammo-management to worry about, that'd require them to give a fuck about how much you find in the levels throughout the game! Instead you just go nuts and whenever you're running low you're automatically given more, for free, from Elizabeth, which she pulls directly from her ass at any given moment. That is, except for the levels where she's running away from you for no reason, because they had to pad the game's length. You found her too quickly in the storyline, so they had to have you re-find her a few times, otherwise you wouldn't have any conflict to work out.

Fuck Bioshock Infinite. I know people like it. I don't get it at all.
